page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: {Papercourt Farm} Papercourt Farm has 200 acres of land mostly consisting of water meadows. Cattle graze on this land and occasionally hay and silage are made on the drier fields. There are 10000 laying hens and 5000 rearing pullets all houses in battery cages. When hens are 76 weeksold they are sent for slaughter. Little is known about the history of the farm, but the present farmers have been there for 28 years. { {Woking Park Farm} Woking Park Farm was previously{Woking {Palace.}Edward Zouch was given the land by Henry VIII who spent Â£180 on building the palace. Elizabeth I stayed for one night but refused to stay longer because of damp. Edward Zouch burnt the palace and used the materials to build{Hoe Place.}
